content.question: Which of the following best explains a connection between the economic productivity of the United States in the mid-1800s and in the late 1800s?

choices.label: The application of new technologies expanded large-scale industrial manufacturing.
Labor unions sought to improve conditions in factories and wages for workers.
The use of sharecropping in the South expanded cotton agricultural production.
Corporationsâ€™ need for managers fostered the growth of a large middle class.

content.answer: The application of new technologies expanded large-scale industrial manufacturing.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
